WRITING.TITLE: [Build Ready] Yet another H440 - any comments/changes?
WRITING.TEXT:
This is a complete overhaul of a four year old desktop that just couldn't handle what I was doing anymore. It is however, my first custom build. Will mainly be used for (apart from everyday things) sound editing (I have a compatible sound card), 3D rendering and design, game design, big coding projects and moderate gaming (Dark Souls, Dawn of War II, Dragon Age, waiting for No Man's Sky, etc). I'll be hoping to run two 1440p monitors off it.
So, any suggestions, changes, anything I done completely and utterly wrong?
[PCPartPicker part list](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/Nk42ZL) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/Nk42ZL/by_merchant/)
Type|Item|Price :----|:----|:---- **CPU** | [Intel Core i7-4790K 4.0GHz Quad-Core Processor](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/intel-cpu-bx80646i74790k) | $319.88 @ OutletPC **CPU Cooler** | [Corsair H100i 77.0 CFM Liquid CPU Cooler](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-cpu-cooler-h100i) | $99.99 @ Best Buy **Thermal Compound** | [Noctua NT-H1 3.5g Thermal Paste](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/noctua-thermal-paste-nth1) | $5.56 @ OutletPC **Motherboard** | [Asus Z97-PRO(Wi-Fi ac) ATX LGA1150 Motherboard](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/asus-motherboard-z97prowifiac) | $209.95 @ SuperBiiz **Memory** | [Corsair Vengeance 16GB (4 x 4GB) DDR3-1866 Memory](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-memory-cmz16gx3m4x1866c9) | $184.99 @ Amazon **Storage** | [Samsung 840 EVO 250GB 2.5" Solid State Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/samsung-internal-hard-drive-mz7te250bw) | $119.99 @ B H **Storage** | [Seagate Barracuda 2TB 3.5" 7200RPM Internal Hard Drive](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/seagate-internal-hard-drive-st2000dm001) | $77.75 @ OutletPC **Video Card** | [Gigabyte GeForce GTX 980 4GB WINDFORCE 3X Video Card](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/gigabyte-video-card-gvn980wf3oc4gd) | $549.99 @ Micro Center **Case** | [NZXT H440 (Black/Red) ATX Mid Tower Case](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/nzxt-case-cah440wm1) | $108.99 @ SuperBiiz **Power Supply** | [Corsair 860W 80+ Platinum Certified Fully-Modular ATX Power Supply](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-power-supply-ax860i) | $197.98 @ Newegg **Case Fan** | [Corsair Air Series AF140 Quiet Edition 67.8 CFM 140mm Fan](http://pcpartpicker.com/part/corsair-case-fan-co9050009ww) | $19.98 @ OutletPC | | **Total** | Prices include shipping, taxes, and discounts when available | $1895.05 | Generated by PCPartPicker 2014-12-28 16:52 EST-0500 |
Side note: Would it be worth waiting for the new Intel processors be worth it, or should I just go for it?
